opening_lines: ..it was the spring of hope, it was the winter of despair.
Stately, plump Buck Mulligan came from the stairhead, bearing a bowl of lather on which a mirror and a razor lay crossed.
In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since.
It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.
It was love at first sight.
Mother died today. Or maybe, yesterday; I can't be sure.
Ships at a distance have every man's wish on board.
I first met Dean not long after my wife and I split up.
All this happened, more or less.
I am a sick man… I am a spiteful man. I am an unattractive man. I think my liver is diseased.
The old man was dreaming about the lions
A screaming comes across the sky:
assorted_notes: even though i pay mind  to neither nail nor coffin
literature must be the axe for the frozen sea within us
people soon get tired of things that aren't boring, but not of what is boring
like an anchorless ship, time floats aimlessly across the broad sea
words have all died in the hollow of time
like flowers scattered in the storm, a man's life is one long goodbye
